{{ru|VEN}} | preceded by = [[2002 South American Rugby Championship "B"|2002]] | succeeded by = [[2004 South American Rugby Championship "B"|2004]] | date ={{nowrap|21–27 September 2003}} }} {{main|South American Rugby Championship}} The '''2003 [[South American Rugby Championship]] "B"''' was the fourth edition of the competition of the second level national Rugby Union teams in South America. The tournament was played in [[Bogota]], with four team participating. Venezuela won for the first time the tournament, winning the direct match with Perù. Every team won at least one match. Brazil participate after lost, against Paraguay, the preliminary round for participating the [[2003 South American Rugby Championship "A"|2003 "A" championship]] == Standings == Three point for victory, two for draw, and one for lost :{| class="wikitable" |- !width=165|Team !width=40|Played !width=40|Won !width=40|Drawn !width=40|Lost !width=40|For !width=40|Against !width=40|Difference !width=40|Pts |- bgcolor=#ccffcc align=center |align=left| {{Ru|VEN}} |3||2||0||1||102||73||+ 29||'''7''' |- align=center |align=left| {{Ru|BRA}} |3||2||0||1||103||41||+ 62||'''7''' |- align=center |align=left| {{Ru|COL}} |3||1||0||2||54||99||- 45||'''5''' |- align=center |align=left| {{Ru|PER}} |3||1||0||2||42||88||- 46||'''5''' |} == Results [http://stats.espnscrum.com/statsguru/rugby/stats/index.html?class=1;orderby=date;spanmax1=31+dec+2003;spanmin1=01+jan+2003;spanval1=span;template=results;trophy=7;type=team;view=match] ESPN Scrum.com - {{TennisEventInfo|2009|KGHM Dialog Polish Indoors| | date=February 2 – February 8 | edition=10th | location=[[Wrocław]], [[Poland]] | champs={{flagicon|GER}} [[Michael Berrer]] | champd={{flagicon|THA}} [[Sanchai Ratiwatana]] / {{flagicon|THA}} [[Sonchat Ratiwatana]] }}
The '''2009 [[KGHM Dialog Polish Indoors]]''' was a professional [[tennis]] tournament played on [[Tennis court#Hard courts|hard courts]]. It was part of the [[Tretorn SERIE+]] of the [[2009 ATP Challenger Tour]]. It was taking place in [[Wrocław]], [[Poland]] between 2 and 8 February 2009.
==Singles main draw entrants== ===Seeds=== {|class="sortable wikitable" |- ! width="70"| Country ! width="155"| Player ! Rank ! Seed |- |{{flag|BEL}} |[[Olivier Rochus]] |119 |1 |- |{{flag|FRA}} |[[Adrian Mannarino]] |129 |2 |- |{{flag|GER}} |[[Michael Berrer]] |134 |3 |- |{{flag|SVK}} |[[Karol Beck]] |140 |4 |- |{{flag|USA}} |[[Sam Warburg]] |144 |5 |- |{{flag|FRA}} |[[Mathieu Montcourt]] |145 |6 |- |{{flag|COL}} |[[Santiago Giraldo]] |150 |7 |- |{{flag|RUS}} |[[Michail Elgin]] |151 |8 |} * Rankings are as of January 19, 2009.
===Other entrants=== The following players received wildcards into the singles main draw: * {{flagicon|POL}} [[Marcin Gawron]] * {{flagicon|POL}} [[Jerzy Janowicz]] * {{flagicon|POL}} [[Michał Przysiężny]] * {{flagicon|POL}} Artur Romanowski
The following players received entry from the qualifying draw: * {{flagicon|ROU}} [[Victor Ioniţă]] * {{flagicon|POL}} [[Dawid Olejniczak]] * {{flagicon|AUT}} [[Philipp Oswald]] * {{flagicon|CZE}} [[Robin Vik]] * {{flagicon|RUS}} [[Alexandre Kudryavtsev]] (as a Lucky Loser)
==Champions== ===Men's Singles=== {{main|2009 KGHM Dialog Polish Indoors – Singles}} {{flagicon|GER}} '''[[Michael Berrer]]''' def. {{flagicon|RUS}} [[Alexandre Kudryavtsev]], 6–3, 6–4
===Men's Doubles=== {{main|2009 KGHM Dialog Polish Indoors – Doubles}} {{flagicon|THA}} '''[[Sanchai Ratiwatana]]''' / {{flagicon|THA}} '''[[Sonchat Ratiwatana]]''' def. {{flagicon|GER}} [[Benedikt Dorsch]] / {{flagicon|USA}} [[Sam Warburg]], 6–4, 3–6, [10–8]
[[Category:2009 ATP Challenger Tour|KGHM Dialog Polish Indoors]] [[Category:2009 in Polish sport|Kghm Dialog Polish Indoors, 2009]] [[Category:KGHM Dialog Polish Indoors]]

{{unreliable sources|date=July 2016}} {{Spanish name|Yéspica|Jaime}} {{Use dmy dates|date=October 2013}} {{Infobox model | name = Aída Yéspica | image = Aida Yespica 2013 Derivate 000.JPG | birth_name = Aída María Yéspica Jaime | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|df=yes|1982|07|15}} | birth_place = [[Barquisimeto]], Venezuela | height = {{convert|173|cm|ftin|abbr=on}}<ref name=qnm>{{cite web|url=http://www.qnm.it/bellezze/modelle/aida_yespica/|title=Aida Yespica|website=QNM}}</ref><ref name=ecc>Introduction to Aida Yespica - Bio, Pictures and some videos!" at hubpages<!-- link removed on spam blacklist list --></ref><ref name=mrm>{{cite web|url=http://www.modelsrating.com/models/aida-yespica%23.VNbeBX3LfK4|archiveurl=https://archive.today/20150208035453/http://www.modelsrating.com/models/aida-yespica%23.VNbeBX3LfK4|deadurl=yes|title=Aida Yespica - Venezuelan Models - Photo Gallery & Profile|date=8 February 2015|archivedate=8 February 2015}}</ref> | haircolor = Black<ref name=qnm/><ref name=ecc/><ref name=mrm/> | eyecolor = Brown<ref name=qnm/><ref name=ecc/><ref name=mrm/> | website = | spouse = }} '''Aída María Yéspica Jaime''' ({{IPA-es|aˈiða maˈɾi.a ˈʝespika ˈxaime}}; born 15 July 1982) is a Venezuelan television personality, model, actress and former beauty pageant contestant active in [[show business]] in [[Venezuela]], [[Italy]], [[Spain]] and the [[United States]] simply as '''Aída Yéspica'''. Considered a [[sex symbol]] of the 2000s and 2010s, due to her considerable beauty and charm, she has participated in variety and reality shows, acted in films and TV programs, posed for several [[nude calendar]]s, and appeared in television commercials. The tabloid press in Italy and abroad have followed developments in her career and personal life.
==Biography== Known as ''Aída Yéspica'',<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.zimbio.com/Aida+Yespica/articles|title=Articles - Aida Yespica - Zimbio|website=''zimbio.com''}}</ref> also as ''Aída María Yéspica'',<ref>{{cite web|url=http://elhorizonte.mx/a/noticia/449981|title=Aída María Yéspica - El Horizonte|last=ElHorizonte}}</ref> her full name at the [[Civil registry|Venezuelan registry]] is ''Aída María Yéspica Jaime''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.football.co.uk/gallery/aida_yespica/album.shtml|title=Aida Yespica - Gallery from football.co.uk|first=Digital Sports Group|last=LTD|website=''football.co.uk''}}</ref> She was born in [[Barquisimeto]].
===Pageant participation=== Yéspica's career began in 2002 in the [[Miss Venezuela]] pageant: as ''[[Miss Amazonas]]'', she represented the state of [[Amazonas (Venezuelan state)|Amazonas]]; although [[Mariangel Ruiz]] won the pageant, Yéspica became a big favorite<ref name=qnm/><ref name=ecc/> among the press: despite her relatively average height (173 cm or 5'8"), her 90-60-90 cm (36"-24"-36") measurements captured significant attention.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.intimamoda.it/news/aida-yespica|title=AIDA YESPICA - IntimaModa<!-- Titolo generato automaticamente -->|access-date=8 July 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160415112034/http://www.intimamoda.it/news/aida-yespica|archive-date=15 April 2016|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
===Modeling career=== Yéspica, in early 2003, moved to [[Milan]] in Italy to start a modeling career: from then on she has obtained a growing reputation in the Italian system of [[showbusiness]], as a model and showgirl, with many covers of Italian magazines (including ''Maxim'', ''GQ'', ''Max'' and ''Fox'') and realizing four [[nude calendar]]s (NC) in Italy<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.yespica.it/calendari2006.html|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140330080117/http://www.yespica.it/calendari2006.html|dead-url=yes|archive-date=30 March 2014|title=Aida Yespica - Sito non ufficiale - Foto Gallery, Immagini, Calendari, Notizie, Biografia|date=30 March 2014}}</ref> (precisely ''NC Fox 2004'',<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.halloitalia.it/viscalendari.asp?tipo=Aida+Yespica+2004|title=Hallo Italia - Calendari Sexy - Calendari Celebrità|website=halloitalia.it}}</ref> ''NC GQ 2005'',<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.areaticino.com/aida-yespica-2005.asp|title=areaticino.com - areaticino Resources and Information.|website=''areaticino.com''}}</ref> ''NC Fapim 2005''<ref>{{cite web|url=http://calendari.excite.it/2005/donne/aida|title=Aida Yespica per Fapim|website=calendari.excite.it}}</ref> and ''NC Riello 2006''<ref>[http://www.tuttogratis.it/celebrita/calendario_aida_yespica_2006/ Calendario Aida Yespica 2006 - Tutto Gratis<!-- Titolo generato automaticamente -->] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160314065317/http://www.tuttogratis.it/celebrita/calendario_aida_yespica_2006/ |date=14 March 2016 }}</ref>) obtaining much success (the [[Corriere della Sera]] put her in first place<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.corriere.it/speciali/2003/Spettacoli/calendari2004/|title=Corriere della Sera -|first=RCS Corriere della|last=Sera|website=Corriere della Sera}}</ref> as liking). She became in June 2003 the [[female lead]]<ref name=isola>{{cite web|url=http://www.publiweb.com/27ott08/aida-yespica.html|title=AIDA YESPICA Febbraio 2011|website=''publiweb.com''}}</ref> of the [[Cesare Cremonini (musician)|Cesare Cremonini]]'s [[videoclip]] ''[[:it:Latin Lover (Cesare Cremonini)|Latin Lover]]'' and some important [[television commercials]] (most notably those for [[Braun]], [[Campari]], [[Calze Sanpellegrino]], [[Nissan]] - this for [[Japan]]<ref name=sean/> - and [[:it:Riunione Adriatica di Sicurtà|RAS]], in the latter Yéspica was starring<ref name=sean>{{cite web|url=http://www2.stile.it/protagonisti/aida-yespica/|title=Aida Yespica, la modella che non conosce 007 - Aida Yespica, la modella che non conosce 007 - Stile.it|last=Nexta|website=Stile.it}}</ref> with [[Sean Connery]]). Yéspica became a big star in the Italian entertainment business, gracing the covers of multiple magazines including ''[[GQ]]'' and ''[[Maxim (magazine)|Maxim]]'', two of the most important [[Lads mags|men's magazines]] in the [[Italy]] of the 2000s and in this period Yéspica appears regularly on [[Fashion TV]] and in the national networks of [[RAI]] and [[Mediaset]] doing photoshoots, [[nude calendar]]s, [[lingerie]] [[pictorial]]s and fashion commercials or as a presenter, model, showgirl and actress. Yéspica in July 2005<ref name=zancan/> became model and spokesperson,<ref name=zancan/> with [[Alberto Gilardino]], of the jewelry line produced by [[Zancan]].<ref name="zancan">{{cite web|url=http://www.affaritaliani.it/economia/yespicagilardinozancan.html|title=Testimonial/ Aida Yespica e Alberto Gilardino per i gioielli Zancan|last=|first=|date=2005-07-22|website=affaritaliani.it|access-date=2018-11-07}}</ref> Yéspica in 2007 became model and spokesperson of sunglasses and eyeglasses of ''Oxydo'' that are produced by the ''[[Safilo|Safilo Group]]'',<ref>[http://www.wmido.com/it/aida-yespica-testimonial-della-collezione-oxydo/]</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mido365.com/it/news/attualita/aida-yespica-testimonial-della-collezione-oxydo|archiveurl=https://archive.today/20141019112822/http://www.mido365.com/it/news/attualita/aida-yespica-testimonial-della-collezione-oxydo|deadurl=yes|title=Mido365 :: Aida Yespica testimonial della collezione Oxydo|date=19 October 2014|archivedate=19 October 2014}}</ref> she became the [[female lead]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://musica.excite.it/aida-yespica-in-un-video-di-coolio-N1339.html|title=Aida Yespica in un video di Coolio}}</ref> of ''[[Dip It]]'', a [[videoclip]] of the American rapper [[Coolio]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.gossip.it/spettacolo/party_con_aida_yespica_e_coolio_sperw.html?id=bc36115f5ebfa46ebaae0c4e0f7df7f2|title=Party con Aida Yespica e Coolio|website=Gossip.it}}</ref> and Yéspica posed totally naked<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.areaticino.com/gossip_aida_yespica.asp|title=areaticino.com - areaticino Resources and Information.|website=''areaticino.com''}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.calendariomania.es/2007/eroticos/Interviu-Aida_Yespica/|title=Aida Yespica - Calendario Interviu 2007|website=calendariomania.es}}</ref> for her [[nude calendar|hottest calendar]], the ''NC [[Interviú]] 2007'' in [[Spain]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.interviu.es/calendario_2007/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100410063842/http://www.interviu.es/calendario_2007/|dead-url=yes|archive-date=10 April 2010|title=interviu - calendario|date=10 April 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://calendari.excite.it/2007/donne/aidayespica|title=Aida Yespica|website=calendari.excite.it}}</ref> obtaining great success.<ref name=inte>http://www.interviu.es/web/buscar?searchText=Aida+Yespica</ref> Yéspica in October 2008<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.spettegola.com/modelle/aida-yespica-una-splendida-mamma.html|title=Aida Yespica, una splendida mamma|date=2 October 2008}}</ref> posed totally naked<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.affaritaliani.it/coffeebreak/pancione-sexy-vip-dolce-attesa-denudano.html|title=Il pancione ti fa sexy: le vip in dolce attesa si denudano}}</ref> during the 8th month of her first [[pregnancy]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.scoopblog.it/aida-yespica-una-sexy-mamma/|title=Aida Yespica, una mamma}}</ref> for the weekly magazine ''[[Chi (magazine)|Chi]]'' obtaining much success. Yéspica in December 2009<ref>{{cite web|url=http://gossip.virgilio.it/foto/aida-yespica-ritrova-sorriso/_mmid1000015543.html%235|archiveurl=https://archive.today/20141019112834/http://gossip.virgilio.it/foto/aida-yespica-ritrova-sorriso/_mmid1000015543.html%235|deadurl=yes|title=Gallerie - DiLei – Donne : Moda, Tendenze, Benessere e Consigli On line<!-- Titolo generato automaticamente -->|archivedate=19 October 2014}}</ref> became the [[female lead]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://digilander.libero.it/sexyaidayespica/biography.html|title=Biografia Aida Yespica|last=Enrico|website=digilander.libero.it}}</ref> of ''[[Get Involved (Ginuwine song)|Get Involved]]'', a [[videoclip]] of the American singer and songwriter [[Ginuwine]], directed by [[Claudio Zagarini]] and [[Marco Pavone]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.televisionando.it/articolo/aida-yespica-seduce-nel-nuovo-video-di-ginuwine/19867/|title=Aida Yespica seduce nel nuovo video di Ginuwine - Televisionando|date=14 December 2009}}</ref> Yéspica became model and spokesperson for ''[[SièLei]]'' (both for the Italian market for the international market) on three occasions, namely the first time in March 2010<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tgcom24.mediaset.it/people/articoli/1000075/aida-yespica-testimonial-sexy-in-lingerie.shtml|title=Aida Yespica testimonial sexy in lingerie - gossip - Tgcom24|website=tgcom24.mediaset.it}}</ref> for the underwear line<ref>{{cite web|url=http://gossip.nanopress.it/aida-yespica-sexy-in-lingerie-per-sielei/P9413/|archiveurl=https://archive.today/20141019112829/http://gossip.nanopress.it/aida-yespica-sexy-in-lingerie-per-sielei/P9413/|deadurl=yes|title=Aida Yespica sexy in lingerie per Sìèlei - NanoPress Gossip|date=19 October 2014|archivedate=19 October 2014}}</ref> and for the bikini line,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.intimamoda.it/news/aida-yespica-si-riprende-tutto|title=Aida Yespica si riprende tutto - IntimaModa<!-- Titolo generato automaticamente -->|access-date=23 July 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160412201038/http://www.intimamoda.it/news/aida-yespica-si-riprende-tutto|archive-date=12 April 2016|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref> the second time in the summer of 2011 for the bikini line<ref>{{cite web|url=http://donna.nanopress.it/moda/sielei-costumi-da-bagno-2011-con-aida-yespica/P203241/|title=SìèLEI costumi da bagno 2011 con Aida Yespica}}</ref> and the third time in November 2011<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cronacaqui.it/gossip/20345_aida-yespica-alza-le-gelide-temperature-con-un-intimo-mozzafiato-foto.html|title=Aida Yespica alza le gelide temperature con un intimo mozzafiato (foto) - CronacaQui<!-- Titolo generato automaticamente -->|access-date=23 July 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160427045940/http://www.cronacaqui.it/gossip/20345_aida-yespica-alza-le-gelide-temperature-con-un-intimo-mozzafiato-foto.html|archive-date=27 April 2016|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref> for the "[[Christmas]] underwear" line.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://gossipglam.iobloggo.com/942/aida-yespica-cecilia-rodriguez-e-melita-toniolo-supersexy-per-natale|title=GossipGlam - Le news e gli scoop più glamour > Aida Yespica, Cecilia Rodriguez e Melita Toniolo supersexy per Natale.|website=gossipglam.iobloggo.com}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.oggi.it/gossip/gossip/2011/12/01/aida-yespica-melita-toniolo-irina-shayk-e-cecilia-rodriguez-il-natale-e-sexy/|title=Aida Yespica, Melita Toniolo, Irina Shayk e Cecilia Rodriguez: il Nata...}}</ref> Yéspica in December 2011 became the [[female lead]] of the [[videoclip]] ''[[You Know Ain’t Love]]'' (song by [[RJ (rapper)|R.J.]] feat. [[Pitbull (rapper)|Pitbull]]).<ref>{{cite web|url=http://altoadige.gelocal.it/bolzano/cronaca/2011/12/08/news/zagarini-il-regista-dei-videoclip-1.4316650|title=Zagarini, il regista dei videoclip - Bolzano - Alto Adige|website=altoadige.gelocal.it}}</ref>
Yéspica posed, shortly after her participation in the [[L'Isola dei Famosi#Season 9|ninth season]] of the reality show ''[[L'isola dei Famosi]]'' aired by [[Rai 2]] in the winter of 2012,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.affaritaliani.it/coffeebreak/aida-yespica-senza-veli-per-playboy.html|title=Aida Yespica senza veli per Playboy}}</ref> for the [[Article (publishing)|cover story]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.softblog.it/post/12491/aida-yespica-icona-di-bellezza-su-playboy|title=softblog.it - Una nuova piattaforma di Backorder è in arrivo|website=softblog.it}}</ref> of the n. 35<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.playboy.it/magazine/46/playboy-35/|archiveurl=https://archive.today/20130413112314/http://www.playboy.it/magazine/46/playboy-35/|deadurl=yes|title=Playboy 35 - Magazine - Playboy|date=13 April 2013|archivedate=13 April 2013}}</ref> (published in May 2012)<ref>[http://www.playboycoverarchive.com/italy/it-2010s/it-2012/it-playboy-cover-may-2012 Playboy Cover] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141019001804/http://www.playboycoverarchive.com/italy/it-2010s/it-2012/it-playboy-cover-may-2012 |date=19 October 2014 }}</ref> of the monthly magazine ''[[Playboy Italia]]'' (the Italian ediction of ''[[Playboy]]'') obtaining much success.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.oggi.it/gossip/gossip/2012/05/15/aida-yespica-conquista-plyboy-con-le-sue-curve-mozzafiato/|title=Aida Yespica conquista Playboy con le sue curve mozzafiato}}</ref> Yéspica in June 2012 became (with [[Nina Senicar]]) the ''evening star'' (madrina della serata) in the 2012 edition of ''Pitti Uomo''<ref name=pitti1/><ref name=pitti2/> as model and spokesperson of ''Sweet Years''.<ref name=pitti1>{{cite web|url=http://www.lanazione.it/moda/2012/06/20/732288-pitti-moda-tendenze.shtml|title=FIRENZE Anche Beppe Grillo a Pitti Uomo - QuotidianoNet|last=QuotidianoNet|date=20 June 2012}}</ref><ref name=pitti2>{{cite web|url=http://multimedia.quotidiano.net/?tipo=photo&media=38062|title=Nina Senicar e Aida Yespica a Pitti per Sweet Years - ===Entertainment=== Considered a [[sex symbol]] of the [[2000s (decade)|2000s]] and 2010s, due to her considerable beauty and charm, Yéspica became an international reality TV star through many important reality shows as: ''[[L'Isola dei Famosi#Season 2|L'isola dei Famosi 2]]'' (the Italian version of ''[[Celebrity Survivor]]'') aired in [[Italy]] by [[Rai 2]] in autumn 2004<ref name=elia>{{cite web|url=http://www.davidemaggio.it/archives/559/momenti-da-non-dimenticare-elia-vs-yespica|title=MOMENTI DA (NON) DIMENTICARE : ELIA VS YESPICA ALL'ISOLA DEI FAMOSI 2|website=DavideMaggio.it}}</ref> and hosted by [[Simona Ventura]] in studio with [[Massimo Caputi]] from the island, ''[[Expedition Robinson|Supervivientes]]'' (the Spanish version of ''[[Survivor (TV series)|Survivor]]'')<ref name=post>{{cite web|url=http://www.tvblog.it/post/32167/lisola-dei-famosi-2012-aida-yespica|title=L'Isola dei Famosi 2012 - Aida Yespica}}</ref> aired in [[Spain]] by [[Telecinco]] in May–July 2006 (this season, named ''[[Supervivientes: Perdidos en el Caribe (2006)|Supervivientes: Perdidos en el Caribe]]'', was won by [[Carmen Russo]]) and hosted by [[Jesús Vázquez Martínez|Jesús Vázquez]] in studio with [[José María Íñigo]] from the island, ''[[L'Isola dei Famosi#Season 9|L'isola dei Famosi 9]]'' (the ''Heroes'' season)<ref name=post/> aired in [[Italy]] by [[Rai 2]] in January–April 2012 and hosted by [[Nicola Savino]] in studio with [[Vladimir Luxuria]] from the island, ''[[Grande Fratello VIP (season 2)|Grande Fratello VIP 2]]'' (the Italian version of ''[[Celebrity Big Brother]]'') aired in [[Italy]] by [[Canale 5]] in autumn 2017<ref name=gf/> and hosted by [[Ilary Blasi]] (with [[Alfonso Signorini]]). The fiery temperament of Yéspica made her a favorite among both Italian and Spanish fans: she subsequently began work as a showgirl and actress in [[Italy]]<ref name=isola/> and also as a [[nude calendar]] model in [[Italy]] and in [[Spain]].<ref name=inte/>
===Television career=== Yéspica from 2003<ref name=isola/> regularly appears on television<ref name=isola/> in various programs dedicated to fashion and in various commercials: her official debut as a showgirl and presenter dates back 2003-2004 edition of the comedy show ''[[:it:Bulldozer (programma televisivo)|Bulldozer]]'' aired by [[Rai 2]] and hosted by [[Federica Panicucci]].<ref name=isola/><ref name=prati/> In the autumn of 2004 Yéspica became one of the competitors<ref name=isola/><ref name=prati/> of the ''[[L'Isola dei Famosi#Season 2|2nd edition]]'' of ''[[L'Isola dei Famosi]]'',<ref name=elia/> a reality show hosted by [[Simona Ventura]] on [[Rai 2]] in which she obtained popularity because she finished at the 5th place in the race. In the 2005-2006 season she became (together with [[Pamela Prati]]) the [[primadonna]]<ref name=isola/><ref name=prati>{{cite web|url=http://ildecoder.com/elenco/Y/AIDA-YESPICA=2009.html|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130917105200/http://ildecoder.com/elenco/Y/AIDA-YESPICA=2009.html|dead-url=yes|archive-date=17 September 2013|title=AIDA YESPICA|date=17 September 2013}}</ref> of the variety of [[Canale 5]] ''[[Torte in faccia]]'' produced by the ''[[Il Bagaglino|Compagnia del Bagaglino]]''. In the spring of 2006 Yéspica participated in the [[Supervivientes: Perdidos en el Caribe (2006)|7th edition]] of ''[[Expedition Robinson|Supervivientes]]'', the Spanish "island" of [[Telecinco]], obtaining the 5th place in the race.<ref name=isola/><ref name=prati/> In 2007 Aída Yéspica became the [[primadonna]]<ref name=isola/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.oggi.it/gossip/gossip/2012/07/18/aida-yespicas-story-da-attrice-a-soubrette-con-qualche-guaio-da-naufraga-a-mamma-e-ora-e-una-moglie/|title=Aida Yespica's Story: da attrice a soubrette (con qualche guaio),...}}</ref> of the variety ''[[E io pago]]'' produced by the ''[[Il Bagaglino|Compagnia del Bagaglino]]'' and aired in the [[prime time]] of [[Canale 5]].<ref name=prati/><ref name=rieccomi>{{cite web|url=http://archivio.panorama.it/societa/Aida-Yespica-rieccomi-adesso-Scherzi-a-parte-vorrei-farlo-io|title=Aida Yespica: rieccomi, adesso Scherzi a parte vorrei farlo io}}</ref> In the winter of 2008 Yéspica became the [[primadonna]] of ''[[Gabbia di matti]]'',<ref name=isola/> a variety (the last with her) of [[Canale 5]] produced by the ''[[Il Bagaglino|Compagnia del Bagaglino]]''.<ref name=prati/> In the summer of 2008 Yéspica became, along with [[Melita Toniolo]] and [[Belén Rodríguez]], one of the correspondent and co-host of ''[[:it:Lucignolo (programma televisivo)|Lucignolo]]'', a program of [[Italia 1]]. A few months later<ref name=rallentamento/> Yéspica suffered from [[postpartum depression]]<ref name=psico/><ref name=teo/> and therefore her television career (and not only)<ref name=contesa/> suffered a sharp slowdown<ref name=rallentamento/> which, according to the journalistic critics,<ref name=danno/> penalized her at least August 2011;<ref name=contesa/> however, after this incident Yéspica never again reached the great success achieved previously the year 2009.<ref name=contesa/> In early 2010 Yéspica supported her friend [[Claudia Galanti]] in her race at ''[[L'Isola dei Famosi#Season 7|L'isola dei famosi 7]]'' and in May 2010 Yéspica became (with [[Juliana Moreira]]) one of the [[guest star]]s and contestants<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.piacenzanight.com/sezione-notizie-articolo.asp?cod=0010693|title=Aida Yespica nuda nel suo calendario spagnolo. Dall’Isola dei Famosi ai rotocalchi - Piacenza Night - Notizie a Piacenza dal 1999}}</ref> of the first edition of ''[[Fenomenal]]'', a variety hosted on [[Italia 1]] by [[Teo Mammucari]].<ref name=rinuncia>[https://archive.is/20141019112834/http://televisione.nanopress.it/news/aida-yespica-rinuncia-a-baila-per-sognando-hollywood/P103061/ Aida Yespica rinuncia a ''Baila!'' per ''Sognando Hollywood'']</ref> Yéspica, during the 2010-2011 season, participated, as a [[guest star]], in the [[Late-night talk show|late night show]] of [[Canale 5]] ''[[Chiambretti Night]]'' (hosted by [[Piero Chiambretti]]); in November 2010 Yéspica attracted the attention and the consent of the [[public opinion]] and of the critics<ref name=ilm>{{cite web|url=http://www.ilmattino.it/societu00e0/moda/aida_yespica_hot_da_chiambretti_striptease_mozzafiato_video-179903.html|title=Aida Yespica "hot" da Chiambretti: striptease mozzafiato/Il video}}</ref> performing, after the interview with the host, in a [[sensual]] [[striptease]].<ref name=ilm/>
In August 2011,<ref name=contesa>{{cite web|url=http://www.davidemaggio.it/archives/43515/dm-live24-13-agosto-2011-la-yespica-contesa-telese-vs-costamagna-baudo-nudo-la-loren-a-villa-certosa|title=DM LIVE24: 13 AGOSTO 2011. LA YESPICA CONTESA, TELESE VS COSTAMAGNA, BAUDO NUDO, LA LOREN A VILLA CERTOSA|website=DavideMaggio.it}}</ref> the Italian press<ref name=contesa/> argued that Aída Yéspica would be dispute<ref name=contesa/> between [[RAI]] and [[Mediaset]] to be inserted in the cast of contestants<ref name=contesa/> in the two new shows planned<ref name=contesa/> for the 2011-2012 season (namely the new shows were the talent show on acting<ref name=rinuncia/><ref name=venier>{{cite web|url=http://www.tvblog.it/post/27189/sognando-hollywood-mara-venier-conduce-su-raiuno-talent-recitazione-con-yespica-cast|title=Sognando Hollywood: Aida Yespica dice sì a Mara (e no alla d'Urso)}}</ref> ''Sognando Hollywood'' hosted by [[Mara Venier]]<ref name=contesa/> on [[Rai 1]] and the talent dance show ''[[Baila!]]'' hosted by [[Barbara d'Urso]]<ref name=contesa/> on [[Canale 5]]), but Yéspica did not took part because the Venier's show was canceled shortly before the broadcast<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tvblog.it/post/31459/mara-venier-sognando-hollywood-e-saltato-meglio-la-vita-in-diretta|title=Mara Venier: "Sognando Hollywood è saltato. Meglio La vita in diretta"}}</ref> and the rival show was closed due to low ratings;<ref>{{cite web|url=http://cinema-tv.virgilio.it/news/tv/baila-chiude-in-anticipo-per-mancanza-ascolti-altro-flop-per-barbara-urso.html|archiveurl=https://archive.today/20120710183735/http://cinema-tv.virgilio.it/news/tv/baila-chiude-in-anticipo-per-mancanza-ascolti-altro-flop-per-barbara-urso.html|deadurl=yes|title=Baila! chiude in anticipo per mancanza d'ascolti: un altro flop per B…|date=10 July 2012|archivedate=10 July 2012}}</ref> since Yéspica had accepted<ref name=venier/> the offer of [[Rai 1]] discarding<ref name=venier/> that of [[Mediaset]], in the winter of 2012 she was put back on [[Rai 2]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.davidemaggio.it/archives/50909/isola-dei-famosi-9-possibile-il-ritorno-di-pappalardo-yespica-cecchi-paone-e-busi|title=ISOLA DEI FAMOSI 9: POSSIBILI I RITORNI DI AIDA YESPICA E ALESSANDRO CECCHI PAONE|website=DavideMaggio.it}}</ref> to take part, in the vip-category (with [[Valeria Marini]], [[Carmen Russo]] and others)<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.oggi.it/people/programmi-tv-spettacoli/2012/01/03/marini-yespica-carmen-russo-il-ritorno-delle-maggiorate-allisola-dei-famosi-9-e-non-solo/|title=Marini, Yespica, Carmen Russo: il ritorno delle maggiorate all’Isola...}}</ref> of ''Heroes'', to the [[L'Isola dei Famosi#Season 9|9th edition]]<ref name=nona>{{cite web|url=http://www.davidemaggio.it/archives/52559/isola-dei-famosi-9-aida-yespica|title=ISOLA DEI FAMOSI 9: AIDA YESPICA|website=DavideMaggio.it}}</ref> of ''[[L'Isola dei Famosi]]'', a reality show hosted by [[Nicola Savino]] where Yéspica obtained very good reviews<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.davidemaggio.it/archives/56122/le-pagelle-della-settimana-tv-19-25-marzo-2012-promossi-beautiful-e-toffanin-bocciati-la-formula-1-spezzatino-e-caterina-gf|title=LE PAGELLE DELLA SETTIMANA TV (19-25 MARZO 2012). Ed è eletta anche...}}</ref><ref name=regina>{{cite web|url=http://www.lastampa.it/2012/04/13/spettacoli/isola-dei-famosi/9/isola-dei-famosi-aida-yespica-incoronata-regina-della-seratona-RmVTCNgS9Yf7aaBSQJEV2K/pagina.html|title=Isola dei Famosi 9, Aida Yespica incoronata regina della "seratona"}}</ref> having been voted the favorite<ref name=seratona/><ref name=regina/> by all contestants. In this reality show Yéspica was, with [[Valeria Marini]],<ref>[https://www.leichic.it/moda-donna/aida-yespica-niente-total-skinny-allisola-dei-famosi-12565.html]</ref> the most important VIP and sex symbol: curiously, in this reality show participated Yéspica and [[Carmen Russo]] who participated in [[Supervivientes:_Perdidos_en_el_Caribe_(2006)|Supervivientes 2006]].
During her career, Yéspica also participated also in others programs: between 2004 and 2012 she took part, as a [[Model (person)|model]], in the successful evening events program ''[[Sfilata d'amore e moda]]'',<ref>[https://www.estense.com/?p=227129]</ref> aired on [[Rete 4]] every summer and hosted by [[Emanuela Folliero]];<ref>[https://www.ilrestodelcarlino.it/ferrara/spettacoli/2012/06/28/736240-comacchio-sfilata-amore-moda-yespica-rodriguez-palmas.shtml]</ref> Yéspica in the summer of 2008 took part, as a [[guest star]], in the successful evening events program ''[[Miss Muretto]]'' aired on [[Italia 1]]; on several occasions over the years she participated, as a [[guest star]], in ''[[Verissimo (TV series)|Verissimo]]'', a gossip talk show hosted by [[Silvia Toffanin]] on [[Canale 5]]; Yéspica, in the 2012-2013 season, participated, as a [[guest star]], in the gossip talk show of [[Sky Uno]] ''[[Celebrity Now - Satira Selvaggia]]'' hosted by [[Selvaggia Lucarelli]] and [[Petra Loreggian]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://mag.sky.it/mag/tv/2012/11/16/celebrity_now_terza_puntata.html|archiveurl=https://archive.today/20141019112906/http://mag.sky.it/mag/tv/2012/11/16/celebrity_now_terza_puntata.html|deadurl=yes|title=Aida, Melita e Biancofiore...Satira sempre più Selvaggia - MAG - Sky.…|date=19 October 2014|archivedate=19 October 2014}}</ref>
In the summer of 2013<ref name=rj/> Yéspica has left the Italian system of [[showbusiness]] because she moved (with her son Aron) in [[Los Angeles]]<ref name=rj>{{cite web|url=http://www.corriere.it/spettacoli/speciali/foto/2013/vip-al-mare/yespica/gita-gommone-aida-yespica_6f7ec70c-f5cd-11e2-8279-238a68ccdabf.shtml|title=Gita in gommone per Aida Yespica|website=Corriere della Sera}}</ref> where she worked as model and actress until the summer of 2016 when she moved in [[Miami]] (with her son Aron) and in [[Italy]] (for working). Yéspica on 16 April 2017 has returned - after some years of total absence - in the Italian television because she participated (with [[Elenoire Casalegno]], [[Anna Falchi]], [[Laura Barriales]] with others contestants) in ''[[:it:Furore (programma televisivo)|Furore]]'', a music game show aired by [[Rai 2]] and hosted by [[Alessandro Greco]] with [[Gigi e Ross]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ufficiostampa.rai.it/dl/UfficioStampa/Articoli/FURORE-68a17a3a-0392-4c83-a67d-2d2a4229ff46.html|title=Ufficio Stampa - RAI2: FURORE|website=ufficiostampa.rai.it}}</ref> In the autumn of 2017<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.davidemaggio.it/archives/152272/grande-fratello-vip-2017-aida-yespica|title=Grande Fratello Vip 2017: Aida Yespica|website=DavideMaggio.it}}</ref> Yéspica became one of the vip-housemates<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.grandefratello.mediaset.it/personaggi/aida.shtml|title=Aida - Grande Fratello VIP - GFVIP|website=Grande Fratello}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.gossipblog.it/post/534722/grande-fratello-vip-2017-aida-yespica-concorrente-scheda-video|title=Grande Fratello Vip 2017, Aida Yespica concorrente (scheda e video)}}</ref> in the [[Grande Fratello VIP (season 2)|second season]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tvblog.it/post/1476835/grande-fratello-vip-2017-concorrenti-cast|title=Grande Fratello Vip 2017, tutti i concorrenti}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.gossip.it/news/gf-vip-2-ilary-blasi-alfonso-signorini-presentano-cast-news.html|title=GF Vip 2: Ilary Blasi e Alfonso Signorini presentano il cast}}</ref> of the ''[[Grande Fratello VIP]]'', the Italian adaptation of [[Celebrity Big Brother]],<ref name=gf>{{cite web|url=https://www.davidemaggio.it/archives/151533/grande-fratello-vip-2017-concorrenti-cast-gf-vip|title=Grande Fratello Vip 2017: i concorrenti|website=DavideMaggio.it}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.grandefratello.mediaset.it/news/gli-inquilini-della-casa-del-gfvip_2169.shtml|archiveurl=https://archive.today/20171013165922/https://www.grandefratello.mediaset.it/news/gli-inquilini-della-casa-del-gfvip_2169.shtml|deadurl=yes|title=Gli inquilini della Casa del #GFVIP - Grande Fratello VIP - GFVIP|date=13 October 2017|archivedate=13 October 2017}}</ref> and in this reality show, hosted by [[Ilary Blasi]] on [[Canale 5]], Yéspica obtained the 5th place in the race,<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.davidemaggio.it/archives/156505/grande-fratello-vip-2017-vincitore-daniele-bossari-percentuali|title=Daniele Bossari vince Grande Fratello Vip 2017|website=DavideMaggio.it}}</ref> a success of public opinion<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.iltempo.it/grande-fratello-vip/2017/12/03/news/grande-fratello-vip-e-l-ora-dello-scontro-finale-tra-i-sei-sopravvissuti-1039184/|title=Grande Fratello Vip, è l'ora dello scontro finale tra i sei sopravvissuti}}</ref> and very good reviews from the journalistic critics.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.quotidiano.net/magazine/foto/gf-vip-1.3581186|title=GF Vip 2, da Aida la guerriera al vincitore Bossari. Le pagelle - QuotidianoNet|last=QuotidianoNet|date=5 December 2017}}</ref> Yéspica, after that reality show, holds since December 2017 the role of "fixed commentator" (''[[:it:opinionista|opinionista fissa]]'') in the sports talk show of [[Italia 1]] ''[[Tiki Taka - Il calcio è il nostro gioco]]'' hosted by [[Pierluigi Pardo]] and aired, with much success, in the [[Late night television|late night slot]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.peoplexpress.it/2017/12/12/tiki-taka-11-dicembre-replica-aida-yespica-melissa-satta-le-regine-pardo-video/|title=Tiki Taka 11 dicembre Replica: Aida Yespica e Melissa Satta le regine di Pardo - Video - Peoplexpress.it|website=peoplexpress.it}}</ref> Yéspica in January 2018<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.davidemaggio.it/archives/157853/programmi-tv-di-stasera-venerdi-19-gennaio-2018-su-rai3-la-mafia-uccide-solo-destate|title=Programmi TV di stasera, venerdì 19 gennaio 2018. Su Rai3 La mafia uccide solo d'estate|website=DavideMaggio.it}}</ref> was one of the judges<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ilsussidiario.net/News/Cinema-Televisione-e-Media/2018/1/19/Superbrain-Anticipazioni-seconda-puntata-Amadeus-Aida-Yespica-e-Roberto-Giacobbo-ospiti-19-gennaio-2018-/802363/|title=SUPERBRAIN 2018, CON PAOLA PEREGO/ Diretta: il vincitore è Giovanni Guzzo con il super tatto (Seconda puntata)}}</ref> in the [[:it:Superbrain - Le supermenti (terza edizione)|3rd season]] of the [[reality show]], hosted by [[Paola Perego]] and aired by [[Rai 1]], ''[[Superbrain - Le supermenti]]'',<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.gossipetv.com/ascolti-tv-venerdi-19-gennaio-2018-337795|title=Ascolti tv venerdì 19 gennaio 2018 - Superbrain vince|website=''gossipetv.com''}}</ref> the Italian version of ''[[:de:Deutschlands Superhirn|Deutschlands Superhirn]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.gossipetv.com/superbrain-anticipazioni-puntata-19-gennaio-2018-giudici-ospiti-337593|title=Superbrain puntata 19 gennaio 2018 - Giudici - Ospiti - Anticipazioni|website=''gossipetv.com''}}</ref> Yéspica in April 2018 was one of the guest stars in the XV season<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.davidemaggio.it/archives/161572/grande-fratello-2018-prima-puntata-eliminato-nominati|title=Grande Fratello 2018, prima puntata del 17 aprile. Malgioglio contro Aida Nizar: «E' insopportabile». Subito fuori Simone Poccia. Al televoto Filippo e Valerio|website=DavideMaggio.it}}</ref> of the reality show ''[[Grande Fratello]]'' hosted by [[Barbara d'Urso]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tvblog.it/post/1533544/grande-fratello-15-17-aprile-2018-diretta|title=GF15, il Grande Fratello Boh ha avuto inizio}}</ref> and aired by [[Canale 5]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.davidemaggio.it/archives/161600/grande-fratello-2018-i-momenti-da-non-dimenticare-della-prima-puntata-video|title=Grande Fratello 2018: i momenti da (non) dimenticare della prima puntata - Video e Foto|website=DavideMaggio.it}}</ref>
Yéspica in May 2018<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cWJzf7_Pv3Y|title=Aida Yespica - Caduta Libera 13 maggio 2018|last=Abbigliamento Donna|date=14 May 2018|via=YouTube}}</ref> was one of the guest stars in the special episode dedicated to [[Mother's Day]]<ref name=mum/> of the quiz show ''Caduta Libera'' hosted by [[Gerry Scotti]] and aired, during the dinner time, by [[Canale 5]].<ref name=mum>{{cite web|url=http://www.video.mediaset.it/video/caduta_libera/full/domenica-13-maggio_841799.html|title=Video Caduta libera!: Domenica 13 maggio - PUNTATE INTERE - MEDIASET ON DEMAND|last=Mediaset|website=Video Mediaset}}</ref> Yéspica from April<ref>[https://www.105.net/video/105-take-away/247030/105-take-away-aida-yespica-si-presenta-con-un-reggaeton-lento.html]</ref> to August<ref>[https://www.105.net/video/105-take-away/250820/105-take-away-vi-augura-buone-vacanze-con-il-best-of-della-stagione.html]</ref> worked, with [[Diletta Leotta]], as a radio host of ''105 Take Away'', a program of [[Radio 105 Network]]. Yéspica in the season 2018-2019 participated, as a [[guest star]], in the program of [[Rai 2]] ''[[Mezzogiorno in Famiglia]]'' (hosted by [[Adriana Volpe]] and produced by [[Michele Guardì]]),<ref>[http://www.tvblog.it/post/1565412/mezzogiorno-in-famiglia-aida-yespica-ospite-prima-puntata]</ref> in the gossip talk show of [[Rai 1]] ''[[Vieni da me]]'' hosted by [[Caterina Balivo]]<ref>[http://www.ufficiostampa.rai.it/dl/UfficioStampa/Articoli/VIENI-DA-ME-51e3a92e-e2ff-4ae1-ae2b-b3005f6f3c74.html]</ref> and in the sports talk show of [[Italia 1]] ''[[Tiki Taka - Il calcio è il nostro gioco]]'' (hosted by [[Pierluigi Pardo]] with [[Wanda Nara]]).
===Career as actress=== In spring 2004<ref name=sformat/> Yéspica debuted as actress reciting (with [[Digei Angelo]], [[Nicola Savino]] and [[Camila Raznovich]]) in ''[[Sformat]]'',<ref name=sformat/> a satirical sitcom aired in the [[Late night television|late night slot]] of [[Rai 2]] and directed by [[Cristian Biondani]];<ref name=sformat>{{cite web|url=http://www.idgt.it/Blumedia.nsf/(ArticoliWWW)/28CC91BDD5E89AEDC1256E52005716FB?OpenDocument=|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20181114031115/http://www.idgt.it/Blumedia.nsf/(ArticoliWWW)/28CC91BDD5E89AEDC1256E52005716FB?OpenDocument=|deadurl=yes|title=Blu Media - Agenzia di informazione quotidiana|date=19 October 2014|archivedate=14 November 2018}}</ref> subsequently she recited in two [[TV movie]]s ''[[Domani è un'altra truffa]]'' and ''[[Di che peccato sei?]]'' aired in the [[prime time]] of [[Canale 5]] respectively in January 2006 and in January 2007 (the producer is the ''[[Il Bagaglino|Compagnia del Bagaglino]]'', a famous [[theater company]] in Italy). She debuted in the cinema in December 2007 reciting (with [[Christian De Sica]], [[Michelle Hunziker]] and [[Fabio De Luigi]]) in ''[[Natale in crociera]]'' (a [[cinepanettone]] directed by [[Neri Parenti]]); Yéspica obtained the consent of critics and [[public opinion]].
Yéspica in 2013<ref name=messa/> launched herself in a new adventure that sees her fully engaged with her friend [[Simona Ilaria di Michele]], an Italian promising young director/producer/writer;<ref name=messa>{{cite web|url=http://www.ilmessaggero.it/SOCIETA/GOSSIP/ayda_yespica_nuda_undersense_foto/notizie/265380.shtml|title=Pagina non Trovata|website=Il Messaggero}}</ref> Yéspica became the [[female lead]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ilmattino.it/societa/piaceri/ayda_yespica_nuda_sul_set_di_undersense_fotogallery/notizie/265384.shtml|title=Ayda Yespica nuda sul set di UnderSense-Fotogallery}}</ref> of the artistic-social [[short film]] ''[[UnderSense]]'', a travel in a woman's mind: Yéspica felt in love with the project<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.gossipetv.com/aida-yespica-nei-panni-di-attrice-in-un-nuovo-cortometraggio-undersense-75350|title=Aida Yespica nei panni di attrice in un nuovo cortometraggio: UnderSense|website=''gossipetv.com''}}</ref> and she decided to become<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.oggi.it/gossip/gossip/2013/04/12/aida-yespica-diventa-sexy-attrice-il-backstage-super-hot/|title=Aida Yespica diventa (sexy) attrice: il backstage super hot}}</ref> also the ''[[executive producer]]''.<ref name=messa/> Moreover, always in 2013,<ref name=lory/> Yéspica became the [[female lead]],<ref name=lory/> with Mexican actress [[Gloria Patricia Contreras]],<ref name=lory/> in the [[short film]] ''[[The Night Club - Osare per credere]]'' directed by the Italian television celebrity [[Lory Del Santo]].<ref name=lory>{{cite web|url=http://www.gossipblog.it/post/120867/lory-del-santo-diventa-regista-the-night-club-lascera-un-segno-indelebile-nelle-coscienze|title=Lory Del Santo diventa regista: "The Night Club lascerà un segno indelebile nelle coscienze"}}</ref>
===Personal life=== During the reality show ''[[L'Isola dei Famosi#Season 2|L'isola dei Famosi 2]]'' (aired in the autumn of 2004), Yéspica started a relationship with fellow contestant [[Francesco Facchinetti]], an Italian singer (son of [[Roby Facchinetti]]); their relationship has often been at the center of Italian gossip, but ended in July 2006. From 2007 to 2009 Yéspica had a love story with [[Matteo Ferrari]], an afro-Italian [[Association football|footballer]], and their relationship has often been at the center of Italian gossip. Yéspica has a son, Aron Ferrari, born on 27 November 2008,<ref name=nato>{{cite web|url=http://www.pourfemme.it/articolo/aida-yespica-e-mamma-nato-il-primo-figlio/850/|title=Aida Yespica è mamma: nato il primo figlio}}</ref> with [[Matteo Ferrari]], who was at that time her boyfriend. Shortly after the birth of Aron,<ref name=nato/> Yéspica suffered of [[postpartum depression]]<ref name=psico>{{cite web|url=http://www.psicoterapeutico.com/aida-yespica-la-depressione-post-partum-e-la-voglia-di-tornare-in-tv/|archiveurl=https://archive.today/20141019112831/http://www.psicoterapeutico.com/aida-yespica-la-depressione-post-partum-e-la-voglia-di-tornare-in-tv/|deadurl=yes|title=Aida Yespica, la depressione post partum e la voglia di tornare in tv|date=19 October 2014|archivedate=19 October 2014}}</ref><ref name=teo>{{cite web|url=http://www.bellezzegossip.com/aida-yespica/aida-yespica-ho-sconfitto-la-depressione-grazie-allamore-per-teo-mammucari-e-di-mio-figlio-aaron|archiveurl=https://archive.today/20141019112836/http://www.bellezzegossip.com/aida-yespica/aida-yespica-ho-sconfitto-la-depressione-grazie-allamore-per-teo-mammucari-e-di-mio-figlio-aaron|deadurl=yes|title=Aida Yespica: "Ho Sconfitto la Depressione Grazie all’Amore per Teo M…|date=19 October 2014|archivedate=19 October 2014}}</ref> and her career suffered serious damage<ref name=rallentamento>{{cite web|url=http://gossip.fanpage.it/aida-yespica-lascia-la-televisione-per-depressione/|title=Aida Yespica lascia la televisione per depressione}}</ref><ref name=danno>{{cite web|url=http://www.nonmidire.it/articolo/aida-yespica-non-abbandona-la-tv/6783/|title=Aida Yespica non abbandona la tv - NonMiDire<!-- Titolo generato automaticamente -->|access-date=8 July 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160318223327/http://www.nonmidire.it/articolo/aida-yespica-non-abbandona-la-tv/6783/|archive-date=18 March 2016|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref> until August 2011;<ref name=contesa/> after this incident she never again reached the great success achieved previously the year 2009.<ref name=contesa/> In January 2009<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.gazzetta.it/Calcio/SerieA/Squadre/Genoa/Primo_Piano/2009/01/08/ferrari.shtml |title=Aida-Ferrari, lite furibonda E la modella fa le valigie | newspaper=[[La Gazzetta dello Sport]]}}</ref> [[Matteo Ferrari]] definitively left Yéspica (and their son Aron).
==Career==
===Television===
====Programs==== * ''[[:it:Bulldozer (programma televisivo)|Bulldozer]]'' ([[Rai 2]], 2003-2004) * ''[[Sfilata d'amore e moda]]'' ([[Rete 4]], 2004-2012) * ''[[Torte in faccia]]'' ([[Canale 5]], 2005-2006) * ''[[E io pago]]'' ([[Canale 5]], 2007) * ''[[Gabbia di matti]]'' ([[Canale 5]], 2008) * ''[[:it:Lucignolo (programma televisivo)|Lucignolo]]'' ([[Italia 1]], 2008) * ''[[Miss Muretto]]'' ([[Italia 1]], 2008) * ''[[Fenomenal]]'' ([[Italia 1]], 2010) * ''[[Chiambretti Night]]'' ([[Canale 5]], 2010-2011) * ''[[Celebrity Now - Satira Selvaggia]]'' ([[Sky Uno]], 2012-2013) * ''[[:it:Furore (programma televisivo)|Furore]]'' ([[Rai 2]], 2017) * ''[[Tiki Taka - Il calcio è il nostro gioco]]'' ([[Italia 1]], 2017-Today) * ''[[:it:Superbrain - Le supermenti (terza edizione)|Superbrain - Le supermenti]]'' ([[Rai 1]], 2018) * ''Caduta Libera'' (Canale 5, 2018) * ''Mezzogiorno in Famiglia'' (Rai 2, 2018) * ''Vieni da me'' (Rai 1, 2018)

===Filmography===

revision.text:
'''Baseball Think Factory''', abbreviated as '''BTF''' or '''BBTF''', is a [[sabermetrics|sabermetrically]]-oriented [[baseball]] web site that features daily news stories in baseball, with original content contributed by [[SABR]] members such as [[Dan Szymborski]]. The site was previously branded as ''Baseball Primer'', and was created in 2001 by the founders of [[Baseball-Reference]]. Contributors who have gone on to work for [[Major League Baseball]] front offices include [[Voros McCracken]],<ref name="voros">{{cite news |first = Gordon|last = Edes |url = http://www.boston.com/sports/baseball/redsox/articles/2004/07/18/figure_on_a_compromise/ |title = Figure on a compromise |publisher = [[The Boston Globe]] |date = 2004-07-18| accessdate = 2009-03-26}}</ref> Carlos Gomez,<ref name="CBW-DBacks">{{cite news |first = Nick|last = Piecoro |url = http://www.azcentral.com/members/Blog/NickPiecoro/10440 |title = New scout more than just a wannabe |publisher = [[The Arizona Republic]]|date = 2007-11-09| accessdate = 2009-03-26}}</ref> and [[Tom Tango]]. [[Bill James]]' ''Baseball Abstract'' books published in the 1980s are widely considered to be the modern predecessor to websites using sabermetrics such as ''baseballthinkfactory'' and [[Baseball Prospectus|baseballprospectus]].<ref>[[Michael Lewis (author)|Michael Lewis]], ''Moneyball'' p. 235, Norton Press, 2004.</ref>
== History ==
The site was founded in 2001 by Jim Furtado and Sean Forman of [[Baseball-Reference]] under the name "Baseball Primer," with a matching URL of (http://www.baseballprimer.com/). The site's emphasis on sabermetric baseball analysis attracted members of the rec.sport.baseball [[Usenet]] groups, and later drew readers of [[Rob Neyer]]'s [[ESPN]] columns. The early site cultivated spirited discussions as a result of the Usenet veterans' familiarity with each other and the fact that registration was not required to post comments. The site also featured a number of original research articles.
In 2004, the site was re-branded as "Baseball Think Factory" and was re-built on a different software platform in order to support the growing user population and accommodate user registration and [[content management]] features.
BTF mainly hosts baseball discussions. ''[[Sports Illustrated]]'' magazine listed the site as an "essential baseball destination," characterizing it as offering "links to significant baseball articles, accompanied by freewheeling, usually informed discussion threads."<ref name="SI">{{cite news|first=Daniel G. |last=Habib |url=http://vault.sportsillustrated.cnn.com/vault/article/magazine/MAG1108770/index.htm |title=Great Site Lines |publisher=[[Sports Illustrated]] |date=2004-09-27 |accessdate=2009-03-26 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081012203721/http://vault.sportsillustrated.cnn.com/vault/article/magazine/MAG1108770/index.htm |archivedate=2008-10-12 |df= }}</ref> [[Michael Lewis (author)|Michael Lewis]] also mentioned the site (as ''baseballprimer'') in his book [[Moneyball]].<ref name="Moneyball">{{Cite book | last=Lewis | first=Michael | authorlink=Michael Lewis | title=Moneyball: The Art of Winning an Unfair Game | date= | publisher=W. W. Norton & Company | location= | isbn=978-0-393-32481-5 | pages=235, 292}}</ref><ref name="SI-Lewis">{{cite news |first=Michael |last=Lewis |url=http://vault.sportsillustrated.cnn.com/vault/article/magazine/MAG1031308/2/index.htm |title=Out of Their Tree |publisher=[[Sports Illustrated]] |date=2004-03-01 |accessdate=2009-03-26 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080614015051/http://vault.sportsillustrated.cnn.com/vault/article/magazine/MAG1031308/2/index.htm |archivedate=2008-06-14 |df= }}</ref>
== Site sections ==
The site features a number of sections with content for different audiences. These include: * ''Baseball Newsstand'' – a newsblog where baseball-related articles are linked. Entries usually feature an excerpt of the article along with a discussion thread. * ''Hall of Merit'' (abbreviated as the HoM) – a sub-site conceived by Joe Dimino as an alternative to the [[National Baseball Hall of Fame and Museum|National Baseball Hall of Fame]] in [[Cooperstown, New York]]. The purpose of the HoM is "to identify the best players in baseball history and thereby identify the omissions and errors that can be found in the other venerable institution."<ref name="HoM-Intro">{{cite news |first = John|last = Murphy |url = http://www.baseballthinkfactory.org/files/hall_of_merit/discussion/welcome_to_the_baseball_hall_of_merit/ |title = Welcome to the Baseball Hall of Merit! |publisher = Baseball Think Factory |date = 2005-08-28| accessdate = 2009-03-26}}</ref> The discussions often appeal to sabermetric criteria, including in-depth understanding of the various historical eras of major league and negro league baseball as well as advanced statistics.<ref>[http://www.baseballthinkfactory.org/files/hall_of_merit/discussion/the_hall_of_merit_plaque_room HoM members elected thus far]</ref><ref>[http://www.baseballthinkfactory.org/files/hall_of_merit/discussion/our_constitution HoM Constitution]</ref> * ''Transaction Oracle'' – Szymborski posts analyses of major league transactions (player signings and trades), and articles on his ZiPS forecasting system, which is designed to forecast player statistics based on past performance and similarities to other major league players. * ''Team Sites'' – sub-sections of the newsblog that link to articles of interest to specific teams. There currently are four such team blogs: Sox Therapy ([[Boston Red Sox]]), Gonfalon Cubs ([[Chicago Cubs]]), Count the Rings ([[New York Yankees]]), and It's Mets...Just Mets ([[New York Mets]]) * ''Game "Chatters"'' – specific threads on regular season and postseason major league baseball games (as well as for special events such as the Olympics or the World Baseball Championship). Site members contribute to the group liveblog during these events. * ''Dialed In'' and ''Primate Studies'' – sub-sites with original baseball research and more in-depth discussion.
== Original research ==
BTF has featured numerous original research articles, primarily under the aforementioned sub-sites "Transaction Oracle," "Dialed In," and "Primate Studies." Several analysts such as [[Mitchel Lichtman]] and [[Tom Tango]] regularly posted original research articles and participated on discussion and criticism of the work at BTF before going on to establish their own sites and to publish results in book form.<ref name="theBook">{{Cite book | last=Tango | first=Tom M. |author2= Lichtman, Michel|author3= Dolphin, Andrew|author4= Palmer, Pete | title=The Book: Playing the Percentages in Baseball | date= 2007| publisher=Potomac Books | location= | isbn=978-1-59797-129-4 }}</ref>
Given that statistics characterizing major league offense (batting) are fairly well established, much of the research posted on BTF spotlight defense (fielding) in the form of statistics more accurate than traditional fielding statistics. Examples include:
===Mitchel Litchman's articles on ultimate zone rating===
Litchman created fielding metrics that use play-by-play records that record the location of individual batted balls. Litchman combines this play-by-play data with his linear-weights system that assigns run values to the various baseball plays and their context within the game (inning, runners on base, score, etc.) Some of his initial articles on the system were posted on BTF.<ref>[http://www.baseballthinkfactory.org/files/primate_studies/discussion/lichtman_2003-03-14_0/ Ultimate Zone Rating (UZR), Part 1], 2003/03/14</ref><ref>[http://www.baseballthinkfactory.org/files/primate_studies/discussion/lichtman_2003-03-21_0/ Ultimate Zone Rating (UZR), Part 2], 2003/03/21</ref>
Lichtman's [[Ultimate zone rating]]s (UZR) statistics can now be found on the baseball website [[Fangraphs]].
===ZiPS===
Szymborski posts updates from his forecasting system known as "ZiPS" under his sub-site ''Transaction Oracle''.<ref>[http://www.baseballthinkfactory.org/files/oracle/ Transaction Oracle]</ref> ZiPS results are also used in his articles evaluating Major League Baseball transactions. These projections can also be found on [[Fangraphs]], updated for in-season projections.
===Chris Dial's ''Dialed In'' columns===
Dial is a [[SABR]] member who contributes articles to BTF, many focusing on statistics measuring defense. Dial has studied [[STATS, Inc.|STATS, Inc.'s]] "zone rating" for years and posts updated statistics based on this data and on [[Retrosheet]] data. Some of Dial's more notable articles include: *Dial provides OPD – a statistic estimating a player's overall contribution on offense and defense. Offensive values were generated using [[Extrapolated Runs]] and defensive values are represented by Dial's DRS (defensive runs saved), which are based on ZR (zone rating) data.<ref>[http://www.baseballthinkfactory.org/files/dialed_in/discussion/final_2008_offense_plus_defense_opd_results/ Final 2008 Offense Plus Defense (OPD) Results], 2008/10/20.</ref> *A reflection on generating statistics based on retrosheet play-by-play fielding data, the relative impact of including line drive (LD) data.<ref>[http://www.baseballthinkfactory.org/files/dialed_in/discussion/defensive_analysis_continuous_improvement/ Defensive Analysis – Continuous Improvement], 2007/12/30.</ref> *Article on how to create a metric to measure a player's performance on defense, based on zone rating (ZR) data. Comparison to Mitchel Lichtman's UZR, which was taken to be the state-of-the-art fielding metric.<ref>[http://www.baseballthinkfactory.org/files/dialed_in/discussion/dr_strangeglove_or_how_i_learned_to_stop_worrying_and_love_zone_rating1/ Dr. StrangeGlove or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love Zone Rating], 2005/11/10.</ref>
===Carlos Gomez's ''Bullpen Mechanics''===
Gomez is a former college and professional pitcher<ref name="CBW-stats">{{cite news |url=http://www.thebaseballcube.com/players/G/Carlos-Gomez.shtml |title=Carlos Gomez |publisher=The Baseball Cube |accessdate=2009-03-25 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080609013122/http://www.thebaseballcube.com/players/G/Carlos-Gomez.shtml |archivedate=2008-06-09 |df= }}</ref> who contributed articles featuring detailed, frame-by-frame analyses of pitcher mechanics. Prior to their publication, the average fan had little access to detailed evaluations of pitchers' mechanics and had to rely on short descriptions gleaned by beat reporters from scouting reports. The [[Arizona Diamondbacks]] organization offered him a position as a scout in 2007.<ref name="CBW-DBacks" />
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== *[http://www.baseballthinkfactory.org/ Baseball Think Factory] *[http://www.baseballprospectus.com/ Baseball Prospectus] *[http://www.sabr.org/ SABR: Society for American Baseball Research]
[[Category:Major League Baseball websites]] [[Category:Baseball websites]] [[Category:Sports blogs]] [[Category:Internet properties established in 2001]]

{{Use dmy dates|date=February 2014}} {{Use British English|date=February 2014}} {{Infobox Sport governing body |assocname= British Radio Car Association |abbrev = BRCA |logo=File:Brca logo1-300x107.png<!-- |thumb|BRCA Current Logo 2016 --> |aff = [[Motor Sports Association]] |affdate = |region =[[European Federation of Radio Operated Model Automobiles|EFRA]] |regionyear = | image = | size = | caption = | sport = Radio controlled racing | category = | jurisdiction = [[United Kingdom]] | founded = 1971 | year closed = | headquarters = [[Stafford]], [[Staffordshire]] | president = | chairman = John Russell (Acting) | secretary = Darren Newton | key staff = Jim Spencer |replaced = |prevfounded = |url =www.brca.org/ |countryflag= United Kingdom |countryflag2= }} The '''British Radio Car Association''' (or '''BRCA''') is an organisation that promotes the construction and racing of all types of [[Radio-controlled car|radio controlled car]]s in the [[United Kingdom]]. Founded in 1971 by [[Ted Longshaw]]<ref>https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x4b0YuvibZ0</ref> and Keith Plested, who was also the founder of PB Racing, a manufacturer of RC cars;<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.kp-designs.co.uk/page12.html# |title=Keith Plested History |access-date=9 November 2009 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080828134714/http://www.kp-designs.co.uk/page12.html# |archive-date=28 August 2008 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }}</ref><ref>[http://rc-radiocontrolled.com/pb_racing_rc_cars.html PB Racing RC Cars | Radio Control Cars | Remote Control Cars<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080131071431/http://rc-radiocontrolled.com/pb_racing_rc_cars.html |date=31 January 2008 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ifmar.org/pdf/History.pdf |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2008-01-25 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071008035619/http://www.ifmar.org/pdf/History.pdf |archivedate=8 October 2007 |df=dmy }}</ref> they coordinate BRCA affiliated clubs in the UK, and offer [[insurance]] for any accidents that might occur.
They also organise regional and national racing events for various classes. Each year the BRCA produces a rules booklet for every UK racing class, such as 1:10 Electric touring cars, 1:8 Nitro circuit cars and 1:16 Electric micro offroad cars with specific rules as regard to maximum and minimum dimensions, and homologated motors and cells. It is recommended (and at some clubs compulsory) to become a BRCA member due to its insurance and health and safety benefits.
The BRCA is a member of the [[European Federation of Radio Operated Model Automobiles]] (EFRA).
The BRCA is also affiliated with the [[Motor Sports Association]] who deal with motorsports in the UK, although deal primarily with full-size racing rather than scale model racing
==Objectives of The British Radio Car Association== As outlined in the constitution of the BRCA their objectives are:<ref>[https://www.brca.org/sections/brca-articles/brca-constitution BRCA Constitution]</ref>
* To promote the construction and competition of radio-controlled cars. * To facilitate the exchange of information and ideas relating to the sport. * To set rules and standards for construction and racing. * To encourage National and International competition within a co-ordinated calendar.
[[File:Grande Bretagne 04324.JPG|right|thumb|BRCA representatives at the 2013 EFRA 1/8 Off-Road Championship]] [[File:Early Logo.jpg|thumb|one of the early logos of the BRCA (1970s-1990s)]]
== Sections within the BRCA == The BRCA is made up of 13 sections, each section maintain and hold their own construction rules for the classes they race: *1/8th Scale Circuit<ref>[https://www.brca.org/8th/8c/ 1/8th Scale Circuit]</ref> *1/12th Scale Circuit<ref>[https://www.brca.org/12th/12c/ 1/12th Scale Circuit]</ref> *1/8th Scale Rally X<ref>[https://www.brca.org/8th/8rx/ 1/8th Scale Rally X]</ref> *1/10th Electric Off Road<ref>[https://www.brca.org/10th/10or/ 1/10th Electric Off Road]</ref> *Various Scale Stock Cars *1/10th Scale IC Circuit *1/5th Scale Circuit *Various Scale Bikes *Large Scale Off Road *1/18th Scale Micro Cars *Various Scale [[Truggy]]
== Major hosted events == 1998 On-Trac held in [[South Shields]]
2016 the BRCA is hosting the first Reedy International 1/12 Race of Champions at [[Central Milton Keynes Shopping Centre|centre:mk]] [[Milton Keynes]]
2017 First ever GT12 Worlds held at centre:mk
== References == {{reflist}}
== External links == * [http://www.brca.org BRCA website]
{{Sports governing bodies of the United Kingdom}}

'''Cycling Australia Hall of Fame''' was established in 2015. The focus of the Hall of Fame is on athletic performance but also acknowledge administrators, officials and coaches. A ‘Legends of the sport’ category will be introduced three years after 2015.
==Selection== The inaugural Selection Committee comprised: [[Peter Bartels]] (Chair), [[Kate Bates]], [[Rob Eva]], [[Matthew Keenan]], [[Mike Turtur]], [[John Trevorrow]] and [[Anna Millward|Anna Wilson]]
There are two categories:
Athlete - An athlete cannot be considered for inclusion into the Hall of Fame until after a two year period following retirement from competition at the highest level. Athletes must be Australian citizens; achieved at the highest level of competition in their chosen discipline; and have the support of their peers.<ref name=hof>{{cite web|title=Cycling Australia Hall of Fame|url=http://cycling.org.au/Home/About-CA/Oppy-Medal/HOF-Selection-Criteria|website=Cycling Australia|accessdate=12 November 2015}}</ref>
General - Administrator, official or coach can be considered for inclusion by providing no less than twenty years of service to the sport; served on Australian teams as a coach or administrator, coached a rider or riders to medal at Olympic Games, Commonwealth Games, World Championships, World Cups, WorldTour races or World Record/s;, made a significant and enduring positive contribution to the development of cycling and its standing in the community; and officiated at Olympic Games, Commonwealth Games, World Championships, World Cups or WorldTour races. <ref name=hof/>
==Inductees==
{| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Athlete!! Year !!Category |- |[[Hubert Opperman]]||2015||Athlete |- |[[Russell Mockridge]]||2015||Athlete |- |[[Dunc Gray|Edgar ' Dunc' Gray]]||2015||Athlete |- |[[Sid Patterson]]||2015||Athlete |- |[[Phil Anderson (cyclist)|Phil Anderson]]||2015||Athlete |- |[[Kathy Watt]]||2015||Athlete |- |[[Anna Millward|Anna Wilson]]||2015||Athlete |- |[[Robbie McEwen]]||2015||Athlete |- |[[Sara Carrigan]]||2015||Athlete |- |[[Ray Godkin]]||2015||General |- |[[Charlie Walsh]]||2015||General |- |[[Gerry Ryan (businessman)|Gerry Ryan]]||2015||General |- |[[Ryan Bayley]]||2016||Athlete |- |[[Oenone Wood]]||2016||Athlete |- |[[Iris Dixon]] (nee Bent)||2016||Athlete |- |[[Christopher Scott (cyclist)|Chris Scott]]||2016||Athlete |- |[[Mary Grigson|Mary Daubert]] (nee Grigson)||2016||Athlete |- |[[Alf Goullet]]||2016||Athlete |} <ref name=inugural>{{cite web|title=Inaugural Cycling Australia Hall of Fame inductees|url=http://www.cycling.org.au/News/All-News/inaugural-cycling-australia-hall-of-fame-inductees|website=Cycling Australia|accessdate=12 November 2015}}</ref> <ref>{{cite web|title=CYCLING AUSTRALIA HALL OF FAME CLASS FOR 2016 ANNOUNCED|url=http://www.cycling.org.au/News/All-News/cycling-australia-hall-of-fame-class-for-2016-announced|website=Cycling Australia News|date=19 October 2016|accessdate=19 October 2016}}</ref>

[[File:Erie Insurance Arena - Interior.JPG|300px]] | former_names = Erie Civic Center (1983–2008)http://www.erieyouthhockey.com/Page.asp?n=80153&org=erieyouthhockey.com
Louis J. Tullio Arena (2008–2012) | address = 809 French Street | location = [[Erie, Pennsylvania]] | coordinates = {{Coord|42|7|41|N|80|4|51|W|region:US-PA_type:landmark|display=title,inline}} | broke_ground = September 1981 | opened = {{Start date|1983|6|7}}{{cite news |title=Millions Have Flocked to Major Downtown Venue Since June 1983|first=Kevin|last=Flowers|url=http://www.goerie.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=/20080615/NEWS02/806150405/-1/ETN|newspaper=[[Erie Times-News]]|date=June 15, 2008|accessdate=June 15, 2008}} | renovated = Dec 2011 – Sept 2013 | owner = Erie County Convention Center Authority | operator = Erie County Convention Center Authority | construction_cost = [[United States dollar|$]]9.3 million | architect = Heidt, Evans & Salata (original)
Sink Combs Dethlefs (renovation) | general_contractor = | tenants = [[Erie Golden Blades]] ([[Atlantic Coast Hockey League (1981–87)|ACHL]]) (1983–1987)
[[Erie Panthers]] ([[ECHL]]) (1988–1996)
[[Erie Wave]] ([[World Basketball League|WBL]]) (1990–1992)
[[Erie Otters]] ([[Ontario Hockey League|OHL]]) (1996–present)
[[Erie Invaders]] ([[Indoor Football League (1999-2000)|IFL]]) (2000)
[[Erie Freeze]] ([[American Indoor Football Association|AIFA]]) (2005–2007)
[[Erie Explosion]] ([[Professional Indoor Football League|PIFL]]) (2008–2015)
[[Lakeland Magic|Erie BayHawks]] ([[NBA Development League|NBA D-League]]) (2008–2017)
Lake Erie Eagles ([[Canadian Premier Junior Hockey League|CPJHL]]) (2016–2018)
[[Erie BayHawks (2017–)|Erie BayHawks]] ([[NBA G League]]) (2017–present)
[[Erie BayHawks (2019–)|Erie BayHawks]] ([[NBA G League]]) (2019–) | seating_capacity = 6,716 (Hockey)
6,562 ([[Indoor American football|Indoor football]])
6,982 (Basketball)
9,360 (Concert)}} '''Erie Insurance Arena''' (originally known as '''Erie Civic Center''' and later, '''Louis J. Tullio Arena''') is a multi-purpose indoor [[arena]] in the [[Downtown Erie|downtown]] area of [[Erie, Pennsylvania]]. It is home to the [[Erie Otters]] of the [[Ontario Hockey League]] and the [[Erie BayHawks (2017–)|Erie BayHawks]] of the [[NBA G League]]. It was built in 1983 as part of the [[Louis J. Tullio]] Plaza, which also includes the [[Warner Theatre (Erie, Pennsylvania)|Warner Theatre]] and [[UPMC Park]] – all of which are administered by the Erie County Convention Center Authority. The arena is named for the [[Erie Insurance Group]], which purchased the [[naming rights]] in May 2012. ==History== Erie Insurance Arena was built for $9.3 million in 1983. It opened in June 1983 with a [[Beach Boys]] concert. Since then, it has hosted entertainers including [[Elton John]], [[Rod Stewart]], [[Cher]], [[Kiss (band)|KISS]], [[Barry Manilow]], [[Alan Jackson]], [[Trans-Siberian Orchestra]], and [[Alice Cooper]]. Erie Insurance Arena has also featured [[Disney on Ice]], [[World Wrestling Entertainment]], [[Impact Wrestling]], the [[Harlem Globetrotters]], and [[Ringling Bros. and Barnum & Bailey Circus]]. In May 2012, the Erie County Convention Center Authority and the [[Erie Insurance Group]] announced a 10-year, $3 million naming agreement that would rename the former Louis J. Tullio Arena, "Erie Insurance Arena." This renaming coincided with the completion of the current $42 million renovation project that was completed in September 2013.{{cite news |title=Tullio Arena to Become Erie Insurance Arena|first=Kevin|last=Flowers|url=http://www.goerie.com/article/20120510/NEWS02/305099873/Tullio-Arena-to-become-Erie-Insurance-Arena|newspaper=[[Erie Times-News]]|date=May 10, 2012|accessdate=May 14, 2012}} The renovation, designed by Friday/Sink Combs Dethlefs Joint Venture Architects, modernized the arena and added some new sections and a landscaped park entrance. Construction on the project was carried out by the [[Pittsburgh]]-based [[Turner Construction Company]]. Improvements included additional seating and concourses. To accommodate this, its footprint expanded from the original {{convert|152,000|sqft|sing=on}} to {{convert|218,000|sqft|sing=on}}. This increased the venue's capacity to 6,833 for hockey, 6,754 for basketball and about 9,000 for concerts. Erie Insurance Arena now has enlarged lobbies, more box office windows, luxury suites, administrative offices, mechanical rooms, training areas, new locker rooms, and a club level sponsored by the ''[[Erie Times-News]]''. Funding for the renovations derived from $32 million pledged by former Pennsylvania governor Ed Rendell, combined with $10 million paid by [[Erie County, Pennsylvania|Erie County]].{{cite web|title=Louis J. Tullion Arena to Undergo $42 Million Renovation & Expansion |url=http://www.erieevents.com/_pdf/Louis%20J%20Tullio%20Arena%20Renovation%20%20Expansion%20Press%20Release.pdf |publisher=Erie County Convention Center Authority |date=October 16, 2012 |accessdate=October 16, 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131004221607/http://www.erieevents.com/_pdf/Louis%20J%20Tullio%20Arena%20Renovation%20%20Expansion%20Press%20Release.pdf |archivedate=October 4, 2013 |df= }} The arena has hosted numerous high school and college basketball games. Two of the most notable basketball games were between [[Cathedral Preparatory School]] and McDowell and local colleges, Gannon University and Mercyhurst University. Both games featured rival schools. Both games generated the most attended high school and college basketball games in city history, both selling out at 5,500. In September 2014, the Erie County Convention Center Authority completed a $1.4 million upgrade to the arena which had been dropped from the previous renovation due to a tightened budget. This upgrade included a closed-circuit video system, high-definition video panels on the east and west ends of the arena, and a high-definition "center ice" video scoreboard. The new scoreboard replaced the scoreboard added in 2006. The video boards replaced scoreboards from the original construction of the arena in 1983. The new scoreboard and video boards were manufactured by [[Daktronics]].{{Cite news |title=Erie Insurance Arena to Get New, High-Definition, Video Scoreboard|first=Kevin|last=Flowers|url=http://goerie.com/erie-insurance-arena-to-get-new-high-definition-video-scoreboard|newspaper=[[Erie Times-News]]|date=May 15, 2014|accessdate=January 24, 2015}} ==2011 NCAA Women's Frozen Four== Louis J. Tullio Arena, in conjunction with [[Mercyhurst University|Mercyhurst College]], hosted the [[2011 NCAA National Collegiate Women's Ice Hockey Tournament]], in which the [[Wisconsin Badgers women's ice hockey|Wisconsin Badgers]] defeated the [[Boston University Terriers women's ice hockey|Boston University Terriers]] in the championship final by a score of 4-1.{{cite web |url=https://www.ncaa.com/news/icehockey-women/2011-03-12/boston-first-ever-frozen-four |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2011-08-05 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120921071707/http://www.ncaa.com/news/icehockey-women/2011-03-12/boston-first-ever-frozen-four |archivedate=2012-09-21 |df= }} ==2014 NCAA Women's Division II National Elite Eight== Erie Insurance Arena, in conjunction with [[Gannon University]], hosted the [[NCAA Division II Women's Basketball Tournament]], in which the [[Bentley Falcons]] defeated the [[West Texas A&M Buffaloes]] 73–65. ==Arena attractions== Erie Insurance Arena offers conventional food and beverage offerings such as [[pizza]] and [[corn dog]]s, as well as some more local items such as Greek [[hot dog]]s, Greek nachos, and [[pepperoni]] balls. The venue offers a separate menu for the floor seats, which includes the shrimp cocktail, spinach artichoke dip, steak burger on a pretzel bun, chicken bacon sandwich, [[cheesesteak]], and a vegetable platter. It also features wine, beer, and mixed cocktail drinks.{{cite web |title=Tullio Arena Reviews, Erie BayHawks|first=Joshua|last=Guiher|url=http://www.stadiumjourney.com/stadiums/tullio-arena-s1184|work=Stadium Journey|year=2012|accessdate=September 7, 2012}} ==Gallery== File:Tullio Arena interior.jpg|Louis J. Tullio Arena, 2008 File:Erie Insurance Arena - Exterior.JPG|Erie Insurance Arena, 2015 ==See also== {{Portal|Erie|Pennsylvania}} *[[Bayfront Convention Center]] *[[Erie County Field House]] ==References== {{reflist|2}} ==External links== * {{Official|http://www.erieinsurancearena.com}} *[http://www.ohlarenaguide.com/otters.htm OHL Arena Guide - Erie Insurance Arena] {{OHL Arenas}} {{CIFL}} {{NBA G League arenas}} [[Category:Indoor arenas in Pennsylvania]] [[Category:Indoor ice hockey venues in the United States]] [[Category:Sports venues in Pennsylvania]] [[Category:Arena football venues]] [[Category:Ontario Hockey League arenas]] [[Category:NBA G League arenas]] [[Category:Erie BayHawks]] [[Category:Sports in Erie, Pennsylvania]] [[Category:Buildings and structures in Erie, Pennsylvania]] [[Category:Tourist attractions in Erie, Pennsylvania]] [[Category:Sports venues completed in 1983]] [[Category:1983 establishments in Pennsylvania]]

{{refimprove|date=September 2016}} [[File:P90xgym.jpg|thumb|A selection of home exercise equipment: yoga blocks, yoga mat, dumbbells, pull-up/chin-up bar, push-up handles and gloves.]]
'''Exercise equipment''' is any apparatus or device used during [[physical activity]] to enhance the strength or conditioning effects of that exercise by providing either fixed or adjustable amounts of resistance, or to otherwise enhance the experience or outcome of an exercise routine.
Exercise equipment may also include such wearable items as proper [[athletic shoe|footgear]], [[weightlifting gloves|gloves]], and [[hydration pack]]s.
==General [[strength training]] equipment==
{{Multiple image|image1 = WristStrap.JPG|image2 = LiftingBelt.JPG|caption1 = A lifting strap.|caption2 = A lifting belt.}} A broad range of different types of exercise equipment are available, including *[[Weight training#Free weights versus weight machines|Free-weight training]]: **Preloaded [[dumbbells]] and conventional dumbbells **[[Kettlebells]] **Preloaded [[barbells]] and conventional barbells **[[Weight plates]]: bumper plates, steel plates, micro-plates **Collars *[[Weight machine]]s *Cables *Rowers *Head/neck harness *Variable resistance training:<ref>{{cite journal | pmc= 4081144 | pmid=25024910 | doi=10.7717/peerj.441 | volume=2 | title=Effectiveness of accommodation and constant resistance training on maximal strength and power in trained athletes | journal=PeerJ | page=e441 | last1 = Ataee | first1 = J | last2 = Koozehchian | first2 = MS | last3 = Kreider | first3 = RB | last4 = Zuo | first4 = L}}</ref> **Elastic bands<ref>{{cite journal | pmc= 3588619 | pmid=23486257 | doi=10.2478/v10078-011-0043-8 | volume=29 | title=The Effects of 24 weeks of Resistance Training with Simultaneous Elastic and Free Weight Loading on Muscular Performance of
